body.p:
Nashville, Tenn Nov 26/64
To his Excelency
Gov. Bramlett

Sir I take the liberty of addressing your Excelency to ask a favor which lies in your power to grant and which will not discommode you in the least But will benifit me a great deal and place me under great obligations to you. I have been a soldier in the Regular U. S. Army for nine years and have two honorable discharges from the same the first is for Expiration of term of service and the second is for reenlistment which dates July 1st/64 I reenlisted right in front of the Enemy at Atlanta Ga I have participated in eighteen Engagements (which my last discharge will show)
I now appeal to your Excelency for some better position than that of a private soldier Although I could desire no more honourably one I think I deserve something more lucrative.

I am a native of Union County Ky and as there is a very few men in the Old Regular army from the state of Ky Your Excelency might give them that has served as long as I some position in one of the Regiments from our good old State. I fell my self competent of a captian or first Lieuts position in Infantry or Artillery or I have served in boath and am thourly conversant with the tacticks of each
Hopeing to hear from you Soon I will close

Most Respectfully
Robert Belt
Battery F. 2nd
U. S. Artillery
Nashville Tenn

2 Arty
Nashville Tenn
Nov 26th 1864_
Belt Robert
Battery (F) 2d U. S. Arty
To The Gov
Desires a position in some Ky Regiment --
L B No 8 -- 1864 P. 229
Recd A. G. O. Nov 28th 1864
